cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy(); },<!----></span><br>                     std::move(obj)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(obj)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d5143b14a00807b40eada4dfb0bce610ffc1477a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d5143b14a00807b40eada4dfb0bce610ffc1477a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d5143b14a00807b40eada4dfb0bce610ffc1477a"><!---->d5143b14a00807b40eada4dfb0bce610ffc1477a<!----></a><br>Author: Peng Huang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Peng Huang &lt;<!----></span>penghuang@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/penghuang@chromium.org"><!---->penghuang@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Feb 08 21:38:39 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Feb 08 21:38:39 2023<!----></span><br><br>Fix UAF problem in AngleVulkanImageBacking<span class="line"><!---->Fix UAF problem in AngleVulkanImageBacking<!----></span><br><br>Right now, we use vulkan fence helper to release the backing.<span class="line"><!---->Right now, we use vulkan fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<span class="line"><!---->to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<!----></span><br>by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1309035<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1309035" title="AddressSanitizer:         Merge review required: M110 is already shipping to stable.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M110 is already shipping to stable.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<span class="line"><!---->1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<span class="line"><!---->2. What changes specifically would you like to merge? Please link to Gerrit.<!----></span><br>3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<span class="line"><!---->3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<!----></span><br>4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<span class="line"><!---->4. Is this a new feature?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        mr-issue-page {

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);

        }

          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    align-items: flex-start;

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

    display: inline;

    border: 0;

    text-decoration: underline;

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }

    box-sizing: border-box;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>asan-linux-release-983326<span class="line"><!---->asan-linux-release-983326<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span><br>But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<T> obj) {<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj) {<!----></span><br>  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr<T> obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy(); },<!----></span><br>                     std::move(obj)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(obj)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>#asan<span class="line"><!---->#asan<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span 0x7fade5e5d228<!----></span><br>READ of size 4 at 0x611000224da0 thread T3<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 4 at 0x611000224da0 thread T3<!----></span><br>SCARINESS: 45         Requesting merge to stable M110 because latest trunk commit (1102905) appears to be after stable branch point (1084008).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to stable M110 because latest trunk commit (1102905) appears to be after stable branch point (1084008).<!----></span><br><br>Requesting merge to dev M111 because latest trunk commit (1102905) appears to be after dev branch point (1097615).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to dev M111 because latest trunk commit (1102905) appears to be after dev branch point (1097615).<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<!----></span><br><br>Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<span class="line"><!---->Sheriffbot has determined this fix is necessary on milestone(s): [].<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process this merge request:<!----></span><br>1.       </div><br>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">

          <slot></slot>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank" cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy(); },<!----></span><br>                     std::move(obj)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(obj)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==52173==ABORTING<span class="line"><!---->==52173==ABORTING<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

            width: 100%;

          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/101.0.0.0 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/101.0.0.0 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>asan-linux-release-983326<span class="line"><!---->asan-linux-release-983326<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>The issue was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <span class="line"><!---->The issue was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span><br>But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<T> obj) {<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj) {<!----></span><br>  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr<T> obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy(); },<!----></span><br>                     std::move(obj)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(obj)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>#asan<span class="line"><!---->#asan<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==52173==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x611000224da0 at pc fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/101.0.0.0 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/101.0.0.0 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>asan-linux-release-983326<span class="line"><!---->asan-linux-release-983326<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->#Reproduce<!----></span><br>The issue was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <span class="line"><!---->The issue was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span><br>But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->void VulkanFenceHelper::EnqueueVulkanObjectCleanupForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<T> obj) {<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj) {<!----></span><br>  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<span class="line"><!---->  EnqueueCleanupTaskForSubmittedWork(<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr<T> obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce([](std::unique_ptr&lt;T&gt; obj, VulkanDeviceQueue* device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy(); },<!----></span><br>                     std::move(obj)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(obj)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>#asan<span class="line"><!---->#asan<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==52173==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x611000224da0 at pc fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

problem:<!----></span><br>#TestOn<span class="line"><!---->#TestOn<!----></span><br>asan-linux-release-983326<span class="line"><!---->asan-linux-release-983326<!----></span><br><br>#Reproduce<span on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank"
