cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->But because it cannot be reproduced stably, CF does not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void device_queue,<!----></span><br>                        bool device_lost) { obj->Destroy(); },<span class="line"><!---->                        bool device_lost) { obj-&gt;Destroy();         Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5666142466932736<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5666142466932736"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5666142466932736<!----></a><br><br>Fuzzer: b0ring_webidl_fuzzer<span class="line"><!---->Fuzzer: b0ring_webidl_fuzzer<!----></span><br>Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_media<span class="line"><!---->Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_media<!----></span><br>Platform Id: linux<span class="line"><!---->Platform Id: linux<!----></span><br><br>Crash Type: Heap-use-after-free READ 4<span class="line"><!---->Crash Type: Heap-use-after-free READ 4<!----></span><br>Crash Address: 0x611000224da0<span class="line"><!---->Crash Address: 0x611000224da0<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>  vk::Image::prepareForSampling<span class="line"><!---->  vk::Image::prepareForSampling<!----></span><br>  vk::Device::prepareForSampling<span class="line"><!---->  vk::Device::prepareForSampling<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d5143b14a00807b40eada4dfb0bce610ffc1477a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" &lt;<!----></span>penghuang@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/penghuang@chromium.org"><!---->penghuang@chromium.org<!----></a>><span fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<span class="line"><!---->to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<!----></span><br>by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10"><!---->f551eeab318726904ceb40b020a07395faf21e10<!----></a><br>Author: Peng Huang <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Peng Huang &lt;<!----></span>penghuang@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/penghuang@chromium.org"><!---->penghuang@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 13 21:49:26 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 13 21:49:26 2023<!----></span><br><br>Fix UAF problem in AngleVulkanImageBacking<span class="line"><!---->Fix UAF problem in AngleVulkanImageBacking<!----></span><br><br>Right now, we use vulkan fence helper to release the backing.<span class="line"><!---->Right now, we use vulkan fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<span class="line"><!---->to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<!----></span><br>by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>Type of crash<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash<!----></span><br>GPU process<span class="line"><!---->GPU process<!----></span><br><br>#Analysis<span class="line"><!---->#Analysis<!----></span><br>I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>template <typename T><span class="line"><!---->template &lt;typename T&gt;<!----></span><br>void fence helper to release the backing.<!----></span><br>It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<span class="line"><!---->It is right, if the last usage of the backing is by skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<span class="line"><!---->the submitted work from ANGLE, skia may call flush finish callback<!----></span><br>to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<span class="line"><!---->to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<!----></span><br>by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not familiar with the Vulcan code, but the ASAN logs clearly give the root cause of the vulnerability.<!----></span><br>image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<span class="line"><!---->image_ is a raw pointer to a VkImage object, created on the main thread via vkCreateImage and possibly freed by the main thread.<!----></span><br>But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in UAF<span class="line"><!---->But the image_object is passed to the T3 thread for use without observe lifetime of the object, resulting in To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4232858<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4232858"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4232858<!----></a><br>2.<span class="line"><!---->2.<!----></span><br>This crash is not a reliable reproduce, and it only happens with asan build. I cannot verify the fix.<span class="line"><!---->This crash is not a reliable reproduce, and it only happens with asan build. I cannot verify the fix.<!----></span><br>3.<span class="line"><!---->3.<!----></span><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br>4.<span class="line"><!---->4.<!----></span><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><br>5.<span class="line"><!---->5.<!----></span><br>No<span class="line"><!---->No<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        There appears an issue with monorail today; please ignore the labels and refer to <span class="line"><!---->There appears an issue with monorail today; please ignore the labels and refer to <!----></span>comment #40<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c40"><!---->comment #40<!----></a> regarding merge approvals<span class="line"><!----> regarding merge approvals<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

skia.<!----></span><br>If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<span class="line"><!---->If the last usage is by gl, the fence helper(skia) isn't aware of<!----></span><br>the the backing is still being referenced<span class="line"><!---->to release the backing while the backing is still being referenced<!----></span><br>by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<span class="line"><!---->by works in ANGLE. Fix the problem by calling glFinish() if the last<!----></span><br>usage is GL.<span class="line"><!---->usage is GL.<!----></span><br><br>Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<span class="line"><!---->Know issue: the finish callback of skia flush() is not always called<!----></span><br>in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<span class="line"><!---->in order. So in edge cases, the UAF problem can still happen.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
